block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018.
FILM

Bronx Annual ''Out Like That!'' Festival, celebrating gay pride in the Bronx: ''Quincea単era,'' directed by Richard Glatzer and Wash Westmoreland; with ''Behind Walls,'' a short film. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. ''Rock Bottom,'' documentary by Jay Corcoran; followed by a discussion with Mr. Corcoran and others. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. Bronx Academy of Arts and Dance, 841 Barretto Street. (718) 842-5223.

Chappaqua ''Menus in the Movies,'' film series with discussions and dessert: ''Trouble in Mind,'' directed by Alan Rudolph. Friday at 7 p.m. Free. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
Nyack Sing-along screening of ''The Wizard of Oz.'' June 10 at 5 p.m. $6 and $8. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Peekskill ''The Wind That Shakes the Barley,'' directed by Ken Loach. Through June 10. $7 and $9. ''Killer of Sheep,'' directed by Charles Burnett. June 10 through 16. $7 and $9. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
FOR CHILDREN
Scarsdale ''Creatures of Woodfrog Pond,'' family program. June 17 at 2 p.m. $3 and $5. Greenburgh Nature Center, 99 Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Annandale-on-Hudson Dance Across Borders USA 2007, free performance and panel discussion series. Schedule and information: fishercenter.bard.edu. Through June 16. Free. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts, Bard College, (845) 758-7900.
Annandale-on-Hudson Hudson Valley Chamber Music Circle: Claremont Trio. June 16 at 8 p.m. $5 to $28. Olin Hall, Bard College. (845) 758-7425.
Brewster ''In the Key of Vee,'' jazz with Vesta G. Williams, vocalist, and others. June 16 at 7:30 p.m. $7 and $9. Southeast Museum, 67 Main Street. (845) 279-7500.

Bronx ''Bronx River Sounds,'' annual summer performing arts series: Ricardo Arias and others; experimental and improvisational music. June 16 at 6 p.m. $10. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.
Croton Falls ''The Sisters Rosensweig,'' comedy by Wendy Wasserstein. Through June 24. $25 and $29. Schoolhouse Theater, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

New Rochelle The Sound Shore Chorale's annual spring concert; Purcell's ''Dido and Aeneas'' and ''Ode to Saint Cecilia.'' June 10 at 4 p.m. $12 and $15. Presbyterian Church of New Rochelle, 50 Pintard Avenue. (914) 636-1583.

Nyack Esera Tuaolo, former N.F.L. player and author of ''Alone in the Trenches,'' football clinic and book signing; part of the Gay Pride Rockland celebration, with outdoor family activities and carnival rides. June 10, 11:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Free. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Pawling Cheryl Wheeler, singer-songwriter. June 10 at 8 p.m. $25 and $27.50. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

White Plains Woodlands Coffeehouse: Yiddish Princess, poetry and music performance group, with Moxie, swing trio. June 16 at 8 p.m. $18. Woodlands Community Temple, 50 Worthington Road. (914) 592-7070.
Yonkers ''Concerto Time at the Orchestra,'' performed by the Yonkers Philharmonic Orchestra. June 10 at 3 p.m. Free. Saunders High School, 183 Palmer Road. (914) 423-3592.
Yonkers Yonkers Pops. June 17 and 24 at 2 p.m. Free. Untermyer Park, 945 North Broadway. (914) 375-3535.
OUTDOORS
Valhalla Albanian heritage festival. June 10, noon to 7 p.m. Free. Kensico Dam Plaza, north end of the Bronx River Parkway. (914) 864-7275.
SPOKEN WORD

New Rochelle Irving Burgie, calypso composer and author, reading and book signing; presented by the African American Art and Cultural Appreciation Council. June 16 at 2 p.m. Free. Ossie Davis Theater, 1 Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.

Sleepy Hollow Open mike. Friday at 8 p.m. $3 and $5. Small press festival, with a book fair, panel discussions and poetry readings. June 17 at 2 p.m. $3 and $5. Hudson Valley Writers' Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
THEATER
Armonk ''Steel Magnolias,'' comedy by Robert Harling, presented by the Armonk Players. Through June 16. $10 and $15. North Castle Public Library, 19 Whippoorwill Road. (914) 273-0011.
Mohegan Lake ''Blithe Spirit,'' by Noel Coward, presented by YCP TheaterWorks. Through June 10. $12 and $15. Van Cortlandtville School, Route 6. (914) 528-4145.

Montrose ''Salome,'' staged reading adapted from the drama by Oscar Wilde; presented by M and M Productions and YCP TheaterWorks. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Hendrick Hudson Free Library, 185 Kings Ferry Road. (914) 739-5654.
Scarsdale ''Nuts,'' drama by Tom Topor, presented by Greenville Community Theater. Thursday through June 24. $12 to $18. Edgemont High School Theater, 200 White Oak Lane. (914) 636-2863.
Stony Point ''Half and Half,'' comedy by James Sherman. Through June 10. $15 to $30. Penguin Repertory Company, 7 Crickettown Road. (845) 786-2873.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Armonk ''Frank Lloyd Wright and Usonia: An Experiment in Living.'' Through June 24. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Beacon ''Bau 30: Fresh Ink -- A Printmaking Event,'' created by Elizabeth Winchester. Through July 8. Reception: July 8, 4 to 6 p.m.; panel discussion at the Howland Cultural Center, June 24 at 4 p.m. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.
Beacon ''Christopher Albert: Skin Trade,'' paintings. Through July 1. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Go North: A Space for Contemporary Art, 469 Main Street.
Beacon ''No East No West,'' group show. Through July 2. Hours: daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Van Brunt Gallery, 460 Main Street. (845) 838-2995.
Bronx ''Caribbean Gardens: Journey to Paradise,'' plant exhibition and related events. Through Sept. 16. $5 to $20. New York Botanical Garden, Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. (718) 817-8616.
Cuddebackville ''From M端hlhausen to the New World: The Bridge Builder J. A. Roebling.'' Opens June 16. Reception: June 16, 4 to 6 p.m. Neversink Valley Area Museum, 26 Hoag Road. (845) 754-8870.

Dobbs Ferry ''Flight Patterns,'' mixed-media show by David Barnett; with abstract paintings by June Otani. Through June 24. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-8548.

Hudson ''Two People, Two Visions: Moscow and St. Petersburg,'' photography by Barbara Birmingham and Wendy Chan. Through June 10. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Hudson Opera House, 327 Warren Street. (518) 822-1438.

Hudson ''Altered States,'' paintings by Michal Bachi and photography by Cynthia Greig. Through July 21. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, noon to 6 p.m. Nicole Fiacco Gallery, 506 Warren Street. (518) 828-5090.

Liberty ''Small Works,'' mixed-media group show by area artists; part of Liberty's bicentennial celebration. Through July 1. Hours: Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Catskill Artists Gallery, 38 South Main Street. (845) 292-0310.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.

North Salem ''Straddling Cultures,'' ceramics by Reena Kashyap. ''Mystic Landscapes: Intuitions of an Order,'' paintings by Martin Ries. ''Incarnation,'' contemporary Korean exhibition. All through Sept. 8. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.

Peekskill ''Paintings From Three Perceptions 2004-2007,'' exhibition by Edward A. Burke. Through July 31. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m., or by appointment. Gallery 25N, 25 North Division Street. (914) 293-0811.
Peekskill ''The Art of Persuasion,'' prints from the New York Society of Etchers. Through June 29. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Peekskill ''Caribbean Mindscapes,'' paintings by Roshi Newman. Through June 30. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Art Gallery at Paramount East, 1016 Brown Street, Suite 101. (914) 734-4232.

Pelham Paintings by Liang Guo. Through June 23. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525. Poughkeepsie Photography by Claudia Gorman. Through June 10. Guided daily house tours. Through Nov. 30. $6 and $9. Locust Grove, 2683 South Road (Route 9). (845) 454-4500, Extension 17.

Poughkeepsie ''Utopian Mirage: Social Metaphors in Contemporary Photography and Film,'' group show of contemporary works. Through July 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Vassar College, Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center. (845) 437-5632.

Purchase ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. ''Cleve Gray: Man and Nature,'' paintings. June 10 through Sept. 2. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Riverdale ''Mind, Body and Land: Photographs From Israel,'' work by Karen Gillerman-Harel. Through July 9. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Hebrew Home at Riverdale, 5901 Palisade Avenue. (718) 581-1596.

Scarsdale ''Words: From Spoken to Seen,'' paintings by Wosene Worke Kosrof. Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Madelyn Jordon Fine Art, 14 Chase Road. (914) 723-8738.

Tivoli ''The Third Annual Landscapes En Plein Air,'' group show. Through June 24. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.

Valhalla ''Tony Moore: Painting With Fire.'' Through July 27. Artist talk and demonstration: July 9, 6:30 to 9:30 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 6 to 8 p.m. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.
White Plains Arts Exchange ''Seeing Stories,'' group show by area children's book illustrators. Through July 28. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, Extension 223.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018.

(845) 440-7584.

Liberty ''Small Works,'' mixed-media group show by area artists; part of Liberty's bicentennial celebration. Through July 1. Hours: Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Catskill Artists Gallery, 38 South Main Street. (845) 292-0310.

Peekskill ''Paintings From Three Perceptions 2004-2007,'' exhibition by Edward A. Burke. Through July 31. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m., or by appointment. Gallery 25N, 25 North Division Street. (914) 293-0811.
Peekskill ''The Art of Persuasion,'' prints from the New York Society of Etchers. Through June 29. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Peekskill ''Caribbean Mindscapes,'' paintings by Roshi Newman. Through June 30. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Art Gallery at Paramount East, 1016 Brown Street, Suite 101. (914) 734-4232.

Pelham Paintings by Liang Guo. Through June 23. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525. Poughkeepsie ''Utopian Mirage: Social Metaphors in Contemporary Photography and Film,'' group show of contemporary works. Through July 29. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Vassar College, Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center. (845) 437-5632.

Purchase ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. ''Cleve Gray: Man and Nature,'' paintings. June 10 through Sept. 2. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Riverdale ''Mind, Body and Land: Photographs From Israel,'' work by Karen Gillerman-Harel. Through July 9. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Hebrew Home at Riverdale, 5901 Palisade Avenue. (718) 581-1596.

Scarsdale ''Words: From Spoken to Seen,'' paintings by Wosene Worke Kosrof. Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Madelyn Jordon Fine Art, 14 Chase Road. (914) 723-8738.

Tivoli ''The Third Annual Landscapes En Plein Air,'' group show. Through June 24. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.

Valhalla ''Tony Moore: Painting With Fire.'' Through July 27. Artist talk and demonstration: July 9, 6:30 to 9:30 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 6 to 8 p.m. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.
White Plains Arts Exchange ''Seeing Stories,'' group show by area children's book illustrators. Through July 28. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, Extension 223.
